com.splunk.cloudfwd

Interface ConnectionCallbacks


  • public interface ConnectionCallbacks
    Callers of Connection's send methods must provide an implementation of ConnectionCallbacks to receive asynchronous notifications about their in-flight events.
    Author:
    ghendrey

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acknowledged(EventBatch events)
      The **acknowledged** function is called once for each EventBatchImpl that has been replicated amongst Splunk Indexers.
      void checkpoint(EventBatch events)
      The **checkpoint** function is called when there are no unacknowledged events in-flight with an id less than or equal to events.getId().
      void failed(EventBatch events, Exception ex)
      The **failed** function is called if there is a failure to deliver EventBatch to Splunk.
      void systemError(Exception e)
      Invoked when a system problem occurs.
      void systemWarning(Exception e)
      Invoked when a system condition occurs that could be indicative of a problem.

    • Method Detail

      • acknowledged

        void acknowledged(EventBatch events)
        The **acknowledged** function is called once for each EventBatchImpl that has been replicated amongst Splunk Indexers. Events sent via Connection.send are internally batched, even if there is only one event in an EventBatchImpl. This is why acknowledgments are per-EventBatchImpl and not per-Event.
        Parameters:
        events -

      • failed

        void failed(EventBatch events,
            Exception ex)
        The **failed** function is called if there is a failure to deliver EventBatch to Splunk.
        Parameters:
        events -
        ex -

      • checkpoint

        void checkpoint(EventBatch events)
        The **checkpoint** function is called when there are no unacknowledged events in-flight with an id less than or equal to events.getId(). If checkpoints are disabled, the checkpoint callback behaves identically to the acknowledged callback.
        Parameters:
        events -

      • systemError

        void systemError(Exception e)
        Invoked when a system problem occurs.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • systemWarning

        void systemWarning(Exception e)
        Invoked when a system condition occurs that could be indicative of a problem. For example, server responses such as 503/Indexer -busy are not errors, but the application may want to record their occurrence
        Parameters:
        e -
